Prerequisites.Prerequisite: Optional: Crack bones with clean hammer or hatchet.

Ingredient.Name: Veal shin and knuckle bones
Ingredient.Notes: Trim any meat from bones and reserve.

Method.Step: Get a roasting pan and place the bones and meat on a rack.
Roast the bones and meat in the oven until it is nicely browned -times and temperatures vary, start at 350, look in the oven once in a while until you see brown.
Put the browned bones and meat in a big stockpot with the mirepoix, bouquet garni, pepper and cloves, and add the water.

Slowly bring the pot to a very, very slow simmer.
Do not let it boil.
Skim the scum from the surface of the stock and wipe any residue from the edge of the pot.
Cover and let it cook this way for 12 hours, checking it from time to time, always skimming any crud which accumulates at the surface.
When this is done, let it cool slightly, strain it and chill it until all of the residual fat hardens at the surface and can be removed.
Strain the stock again (line a colander or sieve with paper towels).
Freeze it in pint containers, use as needed.
